subject: Last chance to register for this complimentary event!
body:
Join LCW as we engage in conversation and learning activities to discuss how we can manage bias for managers and leaders.
 
 
Don't miss this LCW client event: 
Debiasing Performance Management
 
Reserve your seat!
 
This is your last chance to register! You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to this LCW client event!
 
Throughout this one-hour event, we'll explore the biases that often prevent you from objectively evaluating your talent, and share proven strategies for beginning to disrupt bias... not only in time for performance evaluation season, but all-year-long. 
This event allows participants to experience LCW training activities from "Managing Bias for Managers & Leaders" and "Managing Bias in Talent Review".
Together we will: 
Begin to unpack some of the ways bias infiltrates people systems
Introduce bias types so you can learn to recognize implicit bias
Examine case studies that show implicit stereotyping and coded language
Make sure to reserve your seat now; seats for this session are available on a first-come basis! 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: RE: Request for proposal
body:
Hi Melonya,
 
Can you please see below as we have received Tahitia’s note she has left the org just last week.
 
Thanks,
Matt 
 
From:
 Singh, Vivek SV <vivek.singh2@genpact.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, August 29, 2022 10:36 AM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 CHAPMAN, MATTHEW C <matthew.chapman1@genpact.com>
Subject:
 Request for proposal
 
Hello Tahitia,
 
I trust you are well! 
 
We have an open requirement as described below where we need a partner who can support on below requirement,
 
Description of Services: 
Service Provider will provide three (3) separate presentations on Service Provider’s research on topics selected and approved by Genpact.  Service Provider will provide Genpact with webinars on those selected topics.  Genpact has already provided written approval of the topic chosen for the presentation provided on or about May 25, 2022, but the parties will work together to finalize the two remaining presentations and webinars.  Service Provider has already done research on the topics that will be presented during the virtual meetings with Genpact.  Genpact will provide Service Provider with the date and topic for the webinar at least six weeks prior to the delivery of the webinar.  Service Provider will provide Genpact with the requested webinars within six weeks of receiving notice from Genpact of the selected topics.
  
All of the webinars will be approximately sixty minutes long.  
 
 
Project Schedule: 
All presentation will be delivered to Genpact prior to December 31, 2022. Genpact’s nominated representative for this SOW 2 will contact Service Provider’s nominated representative for this SOW 2 at least 6 weeks before the delivery of the webinar for scheduling purposes.
  
The parties will have at least one thirty (30) minute preparation call prior to every presentation. 
 
Location of the Delivery of the Services: 
United States.
 
Please go through the requirement and confirm if you can support us on this and also will request you to share your proposal at the earliest.
 
 
 
Vivek Singh (Global Procurement)
Genpact India Pvt Ltd
 
Email:
 
vivek.singh2@genpact
.com
 
Mobile:
 
+91-8181854888
 
Phase V, Sector 53, Gurgaon, Haryana
INDIA 122010
www.genpact.com

Hello Tahitia & Chuck,
 
Hope all is well with you & LCW!  
 
I am reengaging in work and would like to meet for an update on the Sponsorship program as well as discuss a recent request/inquiry from Kamillah Knight (whom you know from Unilever 
😊
).  She has preliminary approval to deliver a sponsorship program for Danaher Water Platform.   In addition to the Redhouse designed program, Kamillah would like to incorporate some of the executive development program work LCW delivered to Unilever.  I will forward here email request.  
 
I have a very open schedule the next two weeks.  Please suggest a few dates/times you’re available.   Looking forward to seeing you soon!
 
Best regards,

Thank you for the gracious introduction, Arlene. I appreciate you.
 
Hi, Nicole – I am including Tahitia Timmons, one of our Sr. Consultants here at LCW, on this thread as well. Tahitia and I will partner with you on ensuring success in this critical endeavor.

 Friday, July 1, 2022 12:41 PM
To:
 Wormley, Nicole A <
nicole.wormley@danaher.com
>; Chuck Adams <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Roane, Arlene <
arlene.roane@danaher.com
>
Subject:
 DHR Exec Sponsorship Program & LCW 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Arlene Roane 
Sent:
 Monday, June 27, 2022 8:39 AM
To:
 'Chuck Adams' <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Danaher Corp D+I Projects 
 
Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569

subject: RE: Our call today
body:
Thanks, Tamara. I will reach out to Patti on Monday and keep you posted. 
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, August 26, 2022 9:11 AM
To:
 Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard) <Rachel.Coleman@fleishman.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <adrianne.smith@fleishman.com>
Subject:
 RE: Our call today
 
Hello Rachel,
 
Thanks so much, we got the invite for the 29
th
. Our conversation with Lynne Anne went really well, she shared a lot of perspectives that we think will be helpful for global inclusion. It was after our conversation with her that we realized we didn’t have any data from anyone situated in Australia or New Zealand (Pacific) so that’s the gap we were hoping to fill. However, it might also be a good idea for us to speak with Patti Malay and get a different leadership perspective from another part of the region. Could we set that up?
 
Tamara
 
From:
 Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard) <
Rachel.Coleman@fleishman.com

Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Arlene Roane 
Sent:
 Monday, June 27, 2022 8:39 AM
To:
 'Chuck Adams' <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Danaher Corp D+I Projects 
 
Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569

body:
Hello Tahitia & Chuck,
 
Hope all is well with you & LCW!  
 
I am reengaging in work and would like to meet for an update on the Sponsorship program as well as discuss a recent request/inquiry from Kamillah Knight (whom you know from Unilever 
😊
).  She has preliminary approval to deliver a sponsorship program for Danaher Water Platform.   In addition to the Redhouse designed program, Kamillah would like to incorporate some of the executive development program work LCW delivered to Unilever.  I will forward here email request.  
 
I have a very open schedule the next two weeks.  Please suggest a few dates/times you’re available.   Looking forward to seeing you soon!
 
Best regards,

 Friday, July 1, 2022 12:41 PM

 Roane, Arlene <
arlene.roane@danaher.com
>
Subject:
 DHR Exec Sponsorship Program & LCW 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Arlene Roane 
Sent:
 Monday, June 27, 2022 8:39 AM
To:
 'Chuck Adams' <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Danaher Corp D+I Projects 
 
Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569

subject: RE: Our call today
body:
Hello Rachel,
 
Thanks so much, we got the invite for the 29
th
. Our conversation with Lynne Anne went really well, she shared a lot of perspectives that we think will be helpful for global inclusion. It was after our conversation with her that we realized we didn’t have any data from anyone situated in Australia or New Zealand (Pacific) so that’s the gap we were hoping to fill. However, it might also be a good idea for us to speak with Patti Malay and get a different leadership perspective from another part of the region. Could we set that up?
 
Tamara
 
From:
 Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard) <Rachel.Coleman@fleishman.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 25, 2022 4:22 PM
To:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <adrianne.smith@fleishman.com>
Subject:
 RE: Our call today
 
Excellent! I have that date and time held on our side, so I can update the invite tomorrow morning and add you all in. And yes, very excited to have that last interview scheduled and glad it isn’t too far into September! 
 
In terms of getting more input from the Pacific region, we do have a wonderful colleague named Patti Malay, who is the GM of our Manila office and also serves as our DE&I director for the APAC region. She has really great knowledge of the region, especially the DE&I issues that exist in different countries, and I know she would be happy to chat with you. Let me know what you think. We can probably get something scheduled fairly quickly as Patti is usually pretty responsive and flexible. 
 
Just curious, how did the interview with Lynne Anne Davis go? She is oversees our whole APAC region, so I was hoping she would have some good input to share. 
 
Thanks! 
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe <
t.thorpe@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 25, 2022 5:11 PM
To:
 Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard) <
Rachel.Coleman@fleishman.com
>; Daniel Gough <
d.gough@lcwmail.com
>; Vince Bongiovanni <

>; Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <
adrianne.smith@fleishman.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Our call today
 
Hello Rachel,
 
Thanks for your patience. I wanted to follow up and let you know that September 29
th
 is confirmed. And it looks like we finally got that last interview scheduled, which is great news. We are anticipating having a preliminary report for you all mid-September in advance of the read out on the 29
th
.
 
Until then, we are continuing our review and analysis, and we have noted an absence of data and input from the Pacific region, in both the APAC Focus Groups and Interviews, and surveys. Is there any data that you think would give us a broader picture of APAC, and or someone you think we should speak to who could provide insights?
 
Thanks,
Tamara

Hi Tamara and team, 
 
I’ve started to look at calendars for the readout, and it looks like 
Thursday, September 29, 1-2pm CT
 works best on our end. Any chance that could work for your team? 
 
If not, it’d be great if you can share a few other options, and I can work with the team to see what is flexible. Heads up, I’m out the whole week of 9/19 traveling for work, so my availability that week is pretty limited. 
 
I’m hoping to get this scheduled ASAP because schedules are already looking challenging, and I know Adrianne, J.J. and Lisa are all eager to get something on the books to hear about next steps. Please let me know when you get a chance. 
 
Also, I’m sharing a short presentation that our team recently pulled together. They had a series of conversations with GMs about this year’s DE&I survey results, and this deck highlights their findings. This presentation has gotten some attention internally, so I wanted to pass along. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

st

 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <
adrianne.smith@fleishman.com
>
Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel 
 
Rachel Coleman (She/Her)

subject: Thank you for attending "Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace"
body:
You can view the recording of the conversation here!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Hi Tahitia,
Thank you for attending yesterday's live stream, 
Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace
.
 
Here's a recording of yesterday's conversation
 in case you'd like to refer back to it for continued learning.
Want to continue your learning? Check out these resources, curated by Rahimeh, to compliment this discussion:
Video: 
Problematic Anti-Muslim Movie Tropes
HBR Article: 
How Leaders Can Better Support Muslim Women
Islamic Networks Group Article: 
Working with Muslim Employees
Interfaith America Article: 
Are Non-Christian Employees Represented in Your Holiday Policies?
If you'd like to bring conversation around the Muslim experience to your own organization, you might be interested in LCW's cultural immersion, "Understanding the Muslim Experience in the U.S. Today":
 
This Immersion takes a deep look at the complexities of being Muslim in the U.S. and the simultaneously varied and shared experiences and worldviews of this community. The session explores key concepts such as the rich diversity within the Muslim community, the concepts of culture versus religion, current key issues and events impacting Muslim experience and perspectives, understanding and responding to stereotypes, and analyzing the intent versus impact of common messaging and missed opportunities for connection with the Muslim community today.
If you'd like to learn more about this immersion or have additional questions for Rahimeh or Larry, simply respond to this email and we'd be happy to discuss how we can support your organization's continued growth.
Thank you! 
Follow LCW on social media & never miss a live stream!

subject: RE: Our call today
body:
Excellent! I have that date and time held on our side, so I can update the invite tomorrow morning and add you all in. And yes, very excited to have that last interview scheduled and glad it isn’t too far into September! 
 
In terms of getting more input from the Pacific region, we do have a wonderful colleague named Patti Malay, who is the GM of our Manila office and also serves as our DE&I director for the APAC region. She has really great knowledge of the region, especially the DE&I issues that exist in different countries, and I know she would be happy to chat with you. Let me know what you think. We can probably get something scheduled fairly quickly as Patti is usually pretty responsive and flexible. 
 
Just curious, how did the interview with Lynne Anne Davis go? She is oversees our whole APAC region, so I was hoping she would have some good input to share. 
 
Thanks! 
 
From:
 Tamara Thorpe <t.thorpe@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, August 25, 2022 5:11 PM
To:
 Rachel Coleman (FleishmanHillard) <Rachel.Coleman@fleishman.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>; Vince Bongiovanni <v.bongiovanni@lcwmail.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <adrianne.smith@fleishman.com>
Subject:
 RE: Our call today
 
Hello Rachel,
 
Thanks for your patience. I wanted to follow up and let you know that September 29
th
 is confirmed. And it looks like we finally got that last interview scheduled, which is great news. We are anticipating having a preliminary report for you all mid-September in advance of the read out on the 29
th
.
 
Until then, we are continuing our review and analysis, and we have noted an absence of data and input from the Pacific region, in both the APAC Focus Groups and Interviews, and surveys. Is there any data that you think would give us a broader picture of APAC, and or someone you think we should speak to who could provide insights?
 
Thanks,
Tamara

Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

subject: RE: Our call today
body:
Hello Rachel,
 
Thanks for your patience. I wanted to follow up and let you know that September 29
th
 is confirmed. And it looks like we finally got that last interview scheduled, which is great news. We are anticipating having a preliminary report for you all mid-September in advance of the read out on the 29
th
.
 
Until then, we are continuing our review and analysis, and we have noted an absence of data and input from the Pacific region, in both the APAC Focus Groups and Interviews, and surveys. Is there any data that you think would give us a broader picture of APAC, and or someone you think we should speak to who could provide insights?
 
Thanks,
Tamara

Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <
adrianne.smith@fleishman.com
>
Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

subject: See you in 15 minutes! Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace!
body:
We're looking forward to you joining LCW's live stream for this candid discussion!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
"
Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace" starts in 15 minutes!
Hi Tahitia,
We're looking forward to joining you for this candid discussion. Click below to join!
Join the live stream!
 
Here are the details for this live stream:
Date and time
: Thursday, August 25th (2pm CST)
Description:
 While a person’s faith or non-faith is a deeply personal experience, it is also part of the authentic, intersectional identity they bring to the workplace. Yet, many organizations do not consider this important part of workers’ identities outside the Christian faith. In practicing cultural competency, it is crucial that organizations move beyond religious tolerance and toward inclusion­­—especially for non-Christian faiths and non-faiths—to ensure equitable policies for their diverse communities.
In this conversation, Culture Moments host Larry Baker (he/him) and DEI consultant Rahimeh Ramizany (she/her) delve into the complexities of faith in the workplace, drawing on Rahimeh’s experience as a consultant, speaker, DEI expert, and multiethnic, neurodiverse, visibly Muslim American woman.
Live stream link (YouTube):
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s4a4WvXkDDo
Live stream link (LinkedIn):
 
https://www.linkedin.com/video/event/urn:li:ugcPost:6964983243003621376/
Please reach out to 
marketing@lcwmail.com
 with any questions or issues.
See you soon!

subject: Join us for our live stream on Aug. 25th at 2pm CST
body:
Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace!
 
 
Thanks for registering! 
Hi there,
Thanks for registering for our upcoming live stream, "Let's talk about religious inclusion in the workplace". We're excited you can join us!
Here are the details:
Date and time
: Thursday, August 25th (2pm CST)
Description:
 
While a person’s faith or non-faith is a deeply personal experience, it is also part of the authentic, intersectional identity they bring to the workplace. Yet, many workplaces do not consider this crucial part of workers’ identities outside the Christian faith. In practicing cultural competency, it is crucial that organizations move beyond religious tolerance and toward inclusion­­—especially for non-Christian faiths and non-faiths—to ensure equitable policies for their diverse communities.
In this conversation, Culture Moments host Larry Baker (he/him) and DEI consultant Rahimeh Ramizany (she/her) delve into the complexities of faith in the workplace, drawing on Rahimeh’s experience as a consultant, speaker, DEI expert, and multiethnic, neurodiverse, visibly Muslim American woman.
You can join the conversation by attending this complimentary live stream session. Whether you’re a practitioner, ally, or leader, we invite you to join this discussion and bring your questions for our experts.
Live stream link:
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s4a4WvXkDDo
See you soon!
 
Click here to join!
 
Not already following LCW on social?
Follow LCW on your favorite channel and never miss content like this live stream again!

subject: RE: Progressive Review Links Enclosed
body:
Hi Kelly – perhaps changing the words to 
When I present a dissenting perspective to a group of colleagues who are different than I am,…
 
And I was suggesting if we make that change to just remove the voice over (for this one and all the others) vs. trying to re-record.
 
From:
 Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 24, 2022 8:40 PM
To:
 Marisa Afzali <Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>; Melonya Johnson <m.johnson@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Review Links Enclosed
 
Marisa – 
What would you suggest it be changed to? Is there a way to simply remove words? 
Or…
I do know the narrator and could ask that she re-record if necessary. 
 
Thoughts?
 
From:
 Marisa Afzali <
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 24, 2022 5:12 PM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
>; Melonya Johnson <
m.johnson@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Progressive Review Links Enclosed
 
Hi – I’m so sorry for the delay.  I had some unexpected stuff come up, on top of our very busy Inclusion Week here, where we had over 14,000 unique participants taking part in nearly 20 events in five days!  The only last question I had was whether we should adjust the top line of this section. I know there’s voice over attached as well, so we’d probably have to remove the voice over (and not just for this one, but for each of the examples in this section, since it would be odd to have voice over for all the others). We adjusted the copy in the text below it, but not in the top line.  And yes, even though HB7 has a temporary injunction, it ‘s possible we could see it again if it’s appealed, and so I’d hate to have to go into this module again.  I’d love your thoughts on how do-able this would be, so that we can wrap up this work. 
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Friday, August 19, 2022 12:01 PM
To:
 Marisa Afzali <
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
>
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Progressive Review Links Enclosed
 
Hi Marisa. 
I am sure you are already aware but the judge ruled the Woke act violated constitutionality. With that in mind are you ok to sign off on the changes so that the work can be closed out and invoiced? 
We can then start discussing future opportunities and what the plan for 2023 might look like with Progressive and LCW. 
Thank you 
Tahitia

Lake Forest, IL 60045

Thanks for your patience. I was able to get into the links, and they all look good.  I think we’re ready to go with Module 2 and Module 5.  In reviewing Module 6, I found a few more things that concern me under HB& (one of my team, rather than myself did the initial review).  However, as I’m sure you know, there is a court challenge being heard today on FL’s law, so rather than put through more changes, can we hold for a day or two on that module to see if we need to make any additional adjustments (understanding there may be additional cost) depending on whether the law stays in place or not?
 
Thanks!

Cc:
 Adrianne Smith (FleishmanHillard) <
adrianne.smith@fleishman.com
>
Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

subject: RE: Transition to a new LCW Consultant
body:
Hi Tahitia and team – 
 
Tahitia – I wish you well in your new journey!  As a customer, I can say this is a loss for LCW and yet I know LCW has wonderful resources.
 
Kelly – TY for your detailed note last week.  Connor – I look forward to the progress on the UB micro-learnings, and subscription rates when ready.  I know the idea of a “pilot” was discussed – look forward to hearing more about that idea.  
 
Karen
 
Karen Rubano  
 
Global Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Center of Excellence
Stanley Black & Decker
860-304-1228
 
www.stanleyblackanddecker.com
https://www.stanleyblackanddecker.com/careers/working-here
https://www.stanleyblackanddecker.com/who-we-are/our-culture
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 24, 2022 1:44 PM
To:
 Rubano, Karen <Karen.Rubano@sbdinc.com>
Cc:
 Conner Williams <c.williams@lcwmail.com>; Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com>; Daniel Gough <d.gough@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Transition to a new LCW Consultant 
 
***CAUTION: EXTERNAL MESSAGE***
Hi Karen, 
 
I am writing to let you know that I am leaving LCW to pursue personal goals – my last day will be this Friday, August 26
th
. I have a time-sensitive opportunity that I cannot pass up. This was not an easy decision especially because of the work LCW does and the amazing clients I have gotten to work with like yourself. 
 
I believe 
Conner Williams
 
introduced himself last week, as a new team member. He is already up to speed regarding our current conversations and Kelly Salek will continue to support and participate in discussions around e-learning content and our updates to that product line.  You can learn more about Conner by clicking on their name.  
 
Again, thank you so much for your partnership! 
 
Warm regards,
Tahitia

My suggestion would be for your team to accept all changes, sign, and then send over to us for signature (with attachment 1 included). However, if you’d like, we can accept all changes, sign, and then send to you for signature.

As for the MSA – 
I recall we have one in place & instead of amending that one, they wish to use a new MSA, correct?
 I will share this with Chris, along with the NDA. Before I share the MSA, 
some questions… 
1. Did you talk to this client about payment terms yet? (Payment days, invoicing 25% upfront & then on a monthly basis)? 
2. Did you discuss the volume price reduction of 1% (see 3.d.i)? (or any volume discounts/price reductions in general?)
3. Did you discuss our new cancelation & postponement policy?
4. Did you have any convos about IP (intellectual property or ownership of content/work for hire)? Do you know if any of the things they plan to purchase from LCW would be works for hire (things we would custom build for them that they would own)?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

LCW

Thanks for sending.
 
As for the Vendor Assessment Questionnaire – I will share this with TeamLogic IT (our external IT partner). They have been assisting with such requests. 
 
As for the NDA, all looks OK – let me just run in by Chris, as I have a couple of questions.
 
As for the MSA – 
I recall we have one in place & instead of amending that one, they wish to use a new MSA, correct?
 I will share this with Chris, along with the NDA. Before I share the MSA, 
some questions… 
1. Did you talk to this client about payment terms yet? (Payment days, invoicing 25% upfront & then on a monthly basis)? 
2. Did you discuss the volume price reduction of 1% (see 3.d.i)? (or any volume discounts/price reductions in general?)
3. Did you discuss our new cancelation & postponement policy?
4. Did you have any convos about IP (intellectual property or ownership of content/work for hire)? Do you know if any of the things they plan to purchase from LCW would be works for hire (things we would custom build for them that they would own)?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile

subject: How are you? LCW -  is curious to hear your opinion!
body:
Based upon your feedback, opinion and ideas we can create a positive working atmosphere together.
May we ask you a few questions?
 
SHARE YOUR OPINION!
 
Weekly Pulse survey every Wednesday for the next 6 months
 
More about the theme mood
 
Emotions drive our actions and thoughts. Your mood during work can determine how you handle stressful situations, how productive you are and how well you perform. Moods can also trigger (positive or negative) behaviors of co-workers! Therefore it is important for your team or organization to receive regular (anonymous) feedback about how you feel at work and why. In this way they can contribute to your job satisfaction and a positive working climate. 
Thanks in advance!
Safe & Confidential
Participation in surveys of 2DAYSMOOD is not mandatory.

Nicole

subject: How are you managing bias for managers and leaders?
body:
Join LCW as we engage in conversation and learning activities to discuss how we can manage bias for managers and leaders.
 
 
Join us for an LCW client event: 
Debiasing Performance Management
 
Reserve your seat!
 
You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to this LCW client event!
 
Throughout this one-hour event, we'll explore the biases that often prevent you from objectively evaluating your talent, and share proven strategies for beginning to disrupt bias... not only in time for performance evaluation season, but all-year-long. 
This event allows participants to experience LCW training activities from "Managing Bias for Managers & Leaders" and "Managing Bias in Talent Review".
Together we will: 
Begin to unpack some of the ways bias infiltrates people systems
Introduce bias types so you can learn to recognize implicit bias
Examine case studies that show implicit stereotyping and coded language
Make sure to reserve your seat now; seats for this session are available on a first-come basis! 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

subject: RE: Vendor paperwork -reminder
body:
Hi Tahitia,
 
Thanks for sending.
 
As for the Vendor Assessment Questionnaire – I will share this with TeamLogic IT (our external IT partner). They have been assisting with such requests. 
 
As for the NDA, all looks OK – let me just run in by Chris, as I have a couple of questions.
 
As for the MSA – 
I recall we have one in place & instead of amending that one, they wish to use a new MSA, correct?
 I will share this with Chris, along with the NDA. Before I share the MSA, 
some questions… 
1. Did you talk to this client about payment terms yet? (Payment days, invoicing 25% upfront & then on a monthly basis)? 
2. Did you discuss the volume price reduction of 1% (see 3.d.i)? (or any volume discounts/price reductions in general?)
3. Did you discuss our new cancelation & postponement policy?
4. Did you have any convos about IP (intellectual property or ownership of content/work for hire)? Do you know if any of the things they plan to purchase from LCW would be works for hire (things we would custom build for them that they would own)?
 
Thank you!
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

From:

Sent:
 Wednesday, May 11, 2022 3:59 PM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Christi Eseller <ceseller@corticacare.com>; Morgan Kammerer <mkammerer@corticacare.com>
Subject:
 RE: Discussion with Cortica
 
Hi Tahitia,
 
Thank you so much for meeting with us this morning! It was such a pleasure to get to know more about you, your perspective, and your various offerings. After some consideration, we agreed that utilizing you for Pride month might be putting you in too small of a box – you have so much more to offer. We are drawn to you as a speaker because of your unique intersectionality, and we want every aspect of that to have the opportunity to shine because it is what makes you such a great fit for our organization. We would like to utilize you for a 45 min session next year, likely February. The topic would be open ended, but we hope you may be able to speak about your experiences with intersectionality as well as sharing ways in which our clinicians can help to promote health equity. Can you please confirm what your cost would be for this session? We want to ensure we carve out budget for next year specifically to have you speak.
 
Thank you,
 
Miranda Sanchez
 
(she/her)
Senior Human Resources Specialist
 
6160 Cornerstone Court East, Suite 10 
San Diego, CA 92121 
Phone: (858) 252-3718
www.corticacare.com

Hi Edward, 
Great discussion today!
Attached is a proposed quote which can always be modified. I included the facilitated learnings we discussed and three micro learnings with pricing. As I mentioned they are moving away from the current eLearning model toward an LMS (soft launch end of Q4). I have these at 25 users and 6 months (they are not doing 12 months).  There were also price increases since the list you shared and I cannot override them BUT I was able to still have the 25% show up, however that is contingent on the prepay and 4+ and will no longer be available moving forward
I am also enclosing a link to a zip folder with pdfs of the facilitated titles we discussed.

Tahitia

subject: Reminder: SHHH IT'S A SECRET - Fun Plans for Weekly Consultant Mtg 8/22
body:
Just a quick reminder of last week’s email: 
 
Hey Folks, 
 
It was Tamara’s Birthday yesterday the 21
st
 (that’s not the surprise).
 
Having just joined the Culture Crew, I wanted to do something special for her and ask y’all to set up a 
fun birthday background
 
RIGHT BEFORE
 
Monday’s 8/22
 
Weekly Consultant Meeting
. So take a few minutes to choose a fun background OR if backgrounds aren’t your style, party hats, statement jewelry, and fun glasses are encouraged.
 
There are some nice options in Teams (balloons and such) but if you’d like to get fancy, I’ve copied some inspirational birthday backgrounds to this email. 
 
For those not as tech savvy who want to rock a cool background, I’ve included a Teams How-To: 
Change Your Background Before the Meeting Starts
. If anyone wants a quick tutorial, message me on Monday and we’ll get it done!
 
Thanks for your participation in doing something fun for Tamara! 
 
Please message me with any questions and Happy Friday 
😊
 
Best,
Hannah
 
P.S. DON’T TELL TAMARA! IT’S A SECRET!!
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Hannah Strack
Associate Consultant (North Carolina)

subject: Scoro Update: Improved Cost Tracking
body:
Good news! Your Scoro site lcw.scoro.com has been updated! Accurately tracking your costs helps you determine what’s eating away...
 
 
 
Login → 
 
Good news! Your Scoro site 
lcw.scoro.com
 has been updated!
Accurately tracking your costs helps you determine what’s eating away at your profit margin. With this update, we are introducing the much-anticipated retrospective cost linking option, so you can track and manage project-related costs at the most granular level. In addition, we’ve improved Scoro’s export options and polished up a few things on the task management side. 
See what we’ve been up to!
Cost tracking
You can use the 
Quoted vs Actual table
 to keep a close eye on your project budget and profitability. Now it is much easier to 
link cost documents with quote lines
 retrospectively to maintain an up-to-date overview of project-related costs in the Quoted vs Actual table. 
Use the 
Link to quote
 button in the bill/expense detailed view to open up the linking modal. Then simply 
drag and drop the lines
 to link them. You can link any bills and expenses that are created from scratch or imported from Xero, Quickbooks or Expensify. 
Read more
 
Smarter export option
You can now pick and choose which data fields you want to export from your detailed work and financial reports. Simply customize your report view with the information you need and 
export only the visible fields
. 
Read more
 
Task planning in Gantt chart
Now it’s easier to plan tasks with no start and due dates using the 
Gantt chart
. Move your cursor to the relevant task row and place the corresponding task into the desired slot with just a click. 
Read more
 
Group tasks by phases
You can now group tasks in your 
task list
 by project phases. This makes it easier to get a phase-based overview of tasks and distinguish between similarly named tasks in different phases of the same project. 
Read more
 
That's not all! 
See our blog post for more details
.
We do our very best to make Scoro better every day, so we really appreciate your feedback. Let us know what you think at 
help@scoro.com
.
Yours truly,
Team Scoro
 
 
 
© 2022 Scoro Software. | 
www.scoro.com
 
Scoro Software Ltd | The Frames, 1 Phipp Street, EC2A 4PS | London, United Kingdom 
If you need assistance or have any questions, please contact our 
Customer Support
.

subject: RE: Hello from Stanley Black & Decker - Unconscious Bias
body:
Hi Karen –
Happiest Friday!!
 
Based on our conversation a few weeks back and the three needs listed below (I added a 4
th
 need, based on our conversation), here are my responses/proposal:
 
Intro to MUB
:
 
We are interested in seeing the revised e-learning as we are still using the original elearning for all new hires.
The revised version will look similar to the screenshots I shared below. The narration script and onscreen treatments are being outlined and reviewed currently. The newly updated version of IMUB will have a lot of the same content and in a similar flow of content, but with fresher 
What Would You Do
 quiz questions and 
Customer Connections
. This refresh will be available in late October/early November with a subscription model format. 
This course will also be used in many of our 
learning path experiences
 (ways to get learners to deep dive into more concepts that are theme based and have more than one online learning). A subscription model will be used for the distribution of those experiences as well. The costs will range either by number of seats, monthly packages, or an annual membership.  
The 3-hour workshop we have is “
MUB in the Workplace
” – I’m not sure of the replacement, if any
Currently there is no replacement of this and as you previously stated, the content needs a refresh, and suggested a hybrid approach. This is a good idea and one we will be exploring in a future build complete with online videos, supplemental activities (collaboration), and a check-in with a facilitator. This idea and outline have been pitched to the content team and awaiting a review. If you are interested in pursuing this, perhaps we can partner in the build and use your organization to pilot the approach.   
 
Very interested in the 
subscription model pricing
The final pricing of the LMS has not been finalized but will be by 8/31. We are looking to presell annual memberships to the LMS; which includes a learning path experience (1-2 online learnings, 1-2 microlearnings, quarterly DEI articles, and free facilitated spotlight learnings for some heritage/celebration months/themes). The idea is to work with companies to deliver solutions and behavior changing experiences…not just courses. The LMS offering is away to allow clients to customize their learning paths rather than customized content. If interested, I’m happy to set up a meeting to provide you more information.
 
DEI Audit
 
You mentioned starting at ground zero with your DEIB learning needs…interestingly, many of our clients are starting to feel this way as they dig deeper into wanting more than IMUB. They feel as if they have done so many things in the way of DEIB that they need a plan, a path, a way to start moving the needle in behaviors and data. Our DEI audit takes a deep-dive analysis to identify where unconscious bias may exist in processes, projects, and practices across the organization. LCW will then work with SBD to outline a range of de-biasing solutions and create a plan for implementation, including action steps, ERG integration, talent management strategies (or other departmental strategies), and DEIB learnings. I’m happy to share a sample plan of a recent audit.  
 
Please let me know if you have any follow-up questions. I can arrange a demo of each if you like—please advise!
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
KELLY SALEK
Director of Instructional Design
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045
  
 
 
Direct: +1.630.234.7807

Subject:
 RE: Hello from Stanley Black & Decker - Unconscious Bias
 
Hello!  Kelly – TY for taking the time to map out the plans.  In summary, for Stanley Black & Decker purposes:
 
Intro to MUB:  we are interested in seeing the revised e-learning as we are still using the original elearning for all new hires.
The 3 hour workshop we have is “MUB in the Workplace” – I’m not sure of the replacement, if any
Very interested in the subscription model pricing
 
As far as the “pilot” which was brought to the table, I am not sure where that fits in all this.  We are truly starting from scratch.  Please stay in touch with your progress on the above!
 
Karen Rubano  
 
Global Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Center of Excellence
Stanley Black & Decker
860-304-1228
 
www.stanleyblackanddecker.com
https://www.stanleyblackanddecker.com/careers/working-here

 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Wednesday, August 17, 2022 12:27 AM
To:
 Rubano, Karen <
Karen.Rubano@sbdinc.com
>; Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
>
Cc:
 Conner Williams <
c.williams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 RE: Hello from Stanley Black & Decker - Unconscious Bias
 
***CAUTION: EXTERNAL MESSAGE***
 
Karen & Tahitia – 
Thank you for all the clarification below…I am happy to step in a share a few insights from the Product, Design, and Development department at LCW.
 
Currently, we are revamping the look and feel of our online learnings, including the 
Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias
 and accompanying microlearnings on 
Managing Bias in Performance Reviews
 and 
Talent Reviews
 (see table below for full list). The content for all the learnings is in the process of being reviewed and undergoing a research analysis (determining the relevancy and accuracy of the research documentation…some historical documentation is still quite relevant).  
 
Additionally, we have been working on a follow-up to the 
Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias 
that takes the information to the next level, integrating 
habits for practicing conscious inclusion
 and the power of neuroplasticity (
neuroplasticity shapes our processes of behavioral change
). This is like a 201 course on managing bias (see new build below)—Conscious Inclusion. 
 
Maintenance Schedule
Course
Time
Est. Delivery Date
Introduction to Managing Unconscious Bias
20-30 Mins
Mid/End October
Managing Bias in Talent Review
10 Mins
October
Managing Bias in Performance Reviews
10 Mins
October
Conscious Inclusion **
NEW BUILD
 – See concepts below**
20-30 Mins
Early/Mid November
Hiring & Promoting Top Talent
20 Mins
November
Hiring & Promoting Top Talent (Microlearning Series)
10 Min Each (x3)
November
Culture & Identity
20-30 Mins
December
 
Here are the storyboard concepts. During design and development, often we include organizations that want this type of learning to be included in the design process/content review and piloting…of course this includes a price break. For more information, let me know, we can organize a meeting to better align on the cost and process for how this works. Conner Williams is our resident expert in our new course design/development company integrations (cc’d here) as well as our bundled Learning path packages.  
 
 
Lastly, you asked about LCWs Learning platform. We have heard that although there is still a need for one-off purchasing of courses, companies are in need of learning experiences, something that continues and reinforces the need for DEIB experiential learning. With that in mind, we will be offering Learning Path Experiences that provide organizations with learning opportunities that can be used all year long…this might include 1-2 online learning courses, 1-2 microlearnings, articles and trends, and inclusion tips. All these things would be available through a subscription-based model using a cloud-based platform. The product is still in review and aims to be released in November…I’ll have the subscription model pricing done in two weeks.   
 
I am happy to share more about any of the individual projects mentioned above and walk-through the process of being a part of the development of content and/or a pilot [company] participant for the learning platform. 
Best!!!
 
 
-
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
KELLY SALEK

Lake Forest, IL 60045

Hi Karen, 
In answer to your questions: 
#1&2. The e-learning UB offering is currently being revised and refreshed. Unfortunately, what we currently are showing is the previous version and does not showcase the new look and or the updated content. However, I can share some preview slides of another course to help give you a feel for what the new training will look like. 
#3. Yes, we are working on that proposal for your train-the-trainer. I am attaching the original TTT LCW schedule for that program so you have something as a reference for our conversion. I will have something next week for you.  Our understanding of the TTT adaption request: 
Turn the Managing Bias in the Workplace for Leaders live facilitation portion into a dynamic e-modules
Combination microlearnings, videos
Will have competency quizzes to verify learning
Supported by the discussion toolkit (revamped to support content) for learners to use in real-time
Option of a live Q&A (quarterly or biannual LCW staffed event) to support learner question/problem solving

Subject:

Hi Tahitia and Kelly!  I hope all is well and you are surviving multiple heat waves throughout the US 
😊
 
Next week, a small group of SBD DEI and L&D practitioners are starting to discuss how to influence UB awareness across the enterprise.  All agree we have reached the LCW MUBW shelf-life, and all agree we must find a way to deliver a sustainable drip of content to our SBD employees.  Although Managers continue to be a primary target audience, we must think beyond Managers to our independent contributors and our manufacturing population.  All said, I have 3 questions:
 
Is LCW updating the 30 minute UB e-learning introduction that currently all new SBD hires experience? 
The only general UB offer I see on the recent document Tahitia sent me (current micro-learnings, elearnings, workshops) is pictured below.  Many of the research and data dates are quite old – some over 10 years old, many 2014-2017.  Is this product being updated?
I know you are working on a pilot proposal for us to take a look at – how is progress?
 
There is no doubt we have interest in building an UB experience.  LinkedIn learning will be one aspect but we need more.  We need to be cost conscious and yet we need to deliver – a fine balance.  TY for any info you can provide!
 
Karen

subject: RE: SOW Genpact Please review
body:
Hello Vivek,
 
Thanks so much for sending along. We would be happy to sign, however, there are a few outstanding items:
 
On the attached, there is a note from Zoya – this looks like an internal note for your team to resolve/decide if you want to accept the edit. 
Under “Privacy & Data Protection Requirements” it references Attachment 1. Could you please share that with us for review?
All of our redlines/changes have not been accepted by your team. Should I accept all changes, or would you like to do so?
 
My suggestion would be for your team to accept all changes, sign, and then send over to us for signature (with attachment 1 included). However, if you’d like, we can accept all changes, sign, and then send to you for signature.
 
If we sign, we typically use DocuSign and would need to know who will be signing on your end. I believe that will be Palak, correct?
 
If you use DocuSign & sign first, could you please send to Alisa Kolodizner, 
a.kolodizner@lcwmail.com
 Partner & cc me?
 
Please let me know if you have any questions or need more info.
 
Thank you for your patience with this process.
 
Best,
Nicole
 
Nicole Barile
Director of Operations
, 
LCW

subject: SHHH IT'S A SECRET - Fun Plans for Weekly Consultant Mtg 8/22
body:
Hey Folks, 
 
It’s Tamara’s Birthday this Sunday, the 21
st
 (that’s not the surprise).
 
Having just joined the Culture Crew, I wanted to do something special for her and ask y’all to set up a 
fun birthday background
 
RIGHT BEFORE
 
Monday’s 8/22
 
Weekly Consultant Meeting
. So take a few minutes to choose a fun background OR if backgrounds aren’t your style, party hats, statement jewelry, and fun glasses are encouraged.
 
There are some nice options in Teams (balloons and such) but if you’d like to get fancy, I’ve copied some inspirational birthday backgrounds to this email. 
 
For those not as tech savvy who want to rock a cool background, I’ve included a Teams How-To: 
Change Your Background Before the Meeting Starts
. If anyone wants a quick tutorial, message me on Monday and we’ll get it done!
 
Thanks for your participation in doing something fun for Tamara! 
 
Please message me with any questions and Happy Friday 
😊
 
Best,
Hannah
 
P.S. DON’T TELL TAMARA! IT’S A SECRET!!
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Hannah Strack
Associate Consultant (North Carolina)

h.strack@lcwmail.com

subject: Checking in on SOW 2021081
body:
Hi Chantal,
 
I hope you are having a wonderful week!
 
I am writing to let you know that I will be leaving LCW to pursue personal goals – my last day will be Wednesday, August 31
st
.
 
Melonya Johnson will serve as your new LCW partner and consultant, and I know you are in good hands, they are also located in your area and familiar with your organization. We have met and discussed the work you have done with LCW and I will be in the background assisting the LCW team as needed to ensure a smooth transition. 
 
This brings me to 
one final housekeeping item.
 For the e
-learning module for Fostering Inclusion SOW, 2021081
 
sent 8/3 have you been able to review the files, and are they accepted so that the project can be invoiced? 
 
I truly appreciate the time we spent working together and learning about Moog’s D& I journey and goals. Please let me know if you have any questions in the meantime.
 
Again, thank you so much for your partnership! 
 
Warm regards,
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons

Senior Consultant
LCW

Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: RE: Our call today
body:
Hi Tamara and team, 
 
I’ve started to look at calendars for the readout, and it looks like 
Thursday, September 29, 1-2pm CT
 works best on our end. Any chance that could work for your team? 
 
If not, it’d be great if you can share a few other options, and I can work with the team to see what is flexible. Heads up, I’m out the whole week of 9/19 traveling for work, so my availability that week is pretty limited. 
 
I’m hoping to get this scheduled ASAP because schedules are already looking challenging, and I know Adrianne, J.J. and Lisa are all eager to get something on the books to hear about next steps. Please let me know when you get a chance. 
 
Also, I’m sharing a short presentation that our team recently pulled together. They had a series of conversations with GMs about this year’s DE&I survey results, and this deck highlights their findings. This presentation has gotten some attention internally, so I wanted to pass along. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel
