Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
See above suggestion
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
  
See above suggestion
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
  
Good catch, yes, probably so.  If you can look at alternatives, that would be great
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed

subject: We’ve Saved You a Seat for Miro Next

k.salek@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Good day Tahitia and Marisa - 
In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
  
I believe removing the voice over from all is the best way to go.
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.  
That could work, or here’s what we’ve used elsewhere: “My team members’ cultural backgrounds don’t make any difference to me. We’re part of the same team working toward the same business goals, and that’s all we need to work well together”  
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees
 People 
may analyze issues 
differently
 and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)  
I would just use “people” vs “employees”.  We can also remove the extra “differently”
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise.   
Yes, I agree.
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:06 AM
To:
 
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>; Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Post conversation follow-up
 
Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
See above suggestion
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
  
See above suggestion
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
  
Good catch, yes, probably so.  If you can look at alternatives, that would be great
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons

subject: Danaher, Redhouse and LCW Project
body:
Hi Chuck and Dan, 
I have included Dan in the conversation regarding Danaher and  added a zip file on our dropbox (ones from Arlene) . The Link is here 
https://www.dropbox.com/s/hymbz1d4510lk33/DO_NOT_EDIT_%20REMOVE_Files_B_A_E_S_Program%20.zip?dl=0
  Do you know if there is a way to restrict access to that particular folder other then locking editing access since we did not create this content or should we just share Arlene’s dropbox as needed? I was not sure what best practice is here for this type of work. 
My plan was to follow up with Nicole once I have your input.  Also do we want to just all get together briefly to walk Dan through this project? I gave him a semi high level overview of the request. 
 
Invoicing and SOW
For this client I have in my notes we had not determined whether we were invoicing Danaher or Arlene - Redhouse Performance Consulting (RPC).  However, I see that Arlene has since requested we invoice Danaher directly during the time she is out (8 weeks). Nicole Wormley was checking to see if we were still 
active in their system
 – we will need to verify that as I did not see an invoice in 2021.  
 
Did you discuss any costs related to this project with Arlene? I know they want us to take over and do Session 3 of the program and work with Jason Butler at Danaher to support initiate the Latinx program and I can price those items out, but is there a price point we are staying within? This would help with writing that SOW. 
 
LCW Actionable Request 
Black Executive Sponsorship Program (Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC)
Develop and anchor a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).
Request is to have this lead by a Black female (LCW or collaborate an external pick) 
Target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  
Program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  
LCW and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  
The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
Deliver Two IDIs and debrief
Latinx Executive Sponsorship Program 
Assist/Support the initiation of a similar rollout of the Latinx program which is being led by Sr. Director Corp D+I (Needs to be built or perhaps this is the CCLP with a look and feel like Redhouse’s stuff since the plan is to hand this back to Arlene? 
 
Executive Coaching request
Chuck you were checking availability or the possibility of another Black male providing executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.   
 
Thank you 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons
(she/her/hers)
Senior Consultant
LCW 
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

Subject:
 DHR Exec Sponsorship Program & LCW 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Arlene Roane 
Sent:
 Monday, June 27, 2022 8:39 AM
To:
 'Chuck Adams' <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Danaher Corp D+I Projects 
 
Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569

Subject:
 Our call today
 
Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel

subject: You're invited! Prepare for Hispanic Heritage Month with LCW
body:
Join LCW for this complimentary event as we engage in conversation and learning activities to discuss how we can support the Latinx community.
 
 
Join us for an LCW client event: 
Preparing for Hispanic Heritage Month
 
Reserve your seat for this session now!
 
You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to this LCW client event!
 
Throughout this one-hour event, we'll explore key experiences that tend to impact your Latinx colleagues, and share proven strategies for building cultural competence for stronger connections with the Latinx community... not only in time for Hispanic Heritage Month, but all-year-long. 
This unique event allows participants to experience LCW training activities and come together for meaningful discussion. Together we will: 
Gain insight into the depth and rich history of the Latinx community
Examine some experiences that tend to shape the identity of many who identify as members of this culture
Discuss strategies for making the Latinx community feel seen, valued, and respected all-year-long
This session is only available by invite! Use the registration link provided in this email and 
reserve up to 3 seats
 for your organization.
Make sure to reserve your seat now; seats for this session are available on a first-come basis! 
 
 
 
 
Copyright © 2022 Language & Culture Worldwide, LLC, All rights reserved.
Our mailing address is:
100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045
Want to change how you receive these emails?
You can 
update your preferences
 or 
unsubscribe from this list
.

subject: RE: Post conversation follow-up
body:
Hi Marisa, 
No need to apologize traveling can be rough, especially now. I have attached an SOW proposal  (Quote No. 202227) for the work. Once we have that signed off, we can begin formal work on the changes. However, in good faith we have started aspects of this project. We also anticipate having this finalized by early next week now with a draft available to review first. Once I have the signed SOW I can start building those first draft changes. 
What type of availability do you have next week to run through a first draft? 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons

Lake Forest, IL 60045

From:
 Marisa Afzali <Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 14, 2022 6:24 AM
To:
 Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Monica Marcel <m.marcel@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Hi Tahitia and Kelly,
 
My apologies for the delay.  This has been a heavy travel and offsite meeting week.  Tahitia – it was terrific to meet you as well. I’m excited to work with you and Kelly – it was wonderful to reconnect!  My thoughts are below
 
From:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:01 AM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
>; Marisa Afzali <
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
>
Cc:
 Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Good day Tahitia and Marisa - 
In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
  
I believe removing the voice over from all is the best way to go.
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.  
That could work, or here’s what we’ve used elsewhere: “My team members’ cultural backgrounds don’t make any difference to me. We’re part of the same team working toward the same business goals, and that’s all we need to work well together”  
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees
 People 
may analyze issues 
differently
 and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)  
I would just use “people” vs “employees”.  We can also remove the extra “differently”
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise.   
Yes, I agree.
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:06 AM
To:
 
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>; Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Post conversation follow-up
 
Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
See above suggestion
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
  
See above suggestion
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
  
Good catch, yes, probably so.  If you can look at alternatives, that would be great
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed

In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
  
I believe removing the voice over from all is the best way to go.
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.  
That could work, or here’s what we’ve used elsewhere: “My team members’ cultural backgrounds don’t make any difference to me. We’re part of the same team working toward the same business goals, and that’s all we need to work well together”  
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees
 People 
may analyze issues 
differently
 and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)  
I would just use “people” vs “employees”.  We can also remove the extra “differently”
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise.   
Yes, I agree.

subject: FW: Post conversation follow-up
body:
G’morning!!
Did you by chance want to talk about a strategy to reply to this and try to and entice for next year’s work with what we have cooking…LMS…Conscious Inclusion…? Free to chat tomorrow in the car or next week. 
 
The changes below will take me minimal time and I know they are under a time crunch to get these done. Happy to put this on my to-do list for early in the week next week. I can have them all done in a day. I’ll book off my Wednesday next week if the SOW is signed. 
 
Best!!
 
From:
 Marisa Afzali <Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com> 
Sent:
 Thursday, July 14, 2022 5:24 AM
To:
 Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com>; Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Monica Marcel <m.marcel@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Hi Tahitia and Kelly,
 
My apologies for the delay.  This has been a heavy travel and offsite meeting week.  Tahitia – it was terrific to meet you as well. I’m excited to work with you and Kelly – it was wonderful to reconnect!  My thoughts are below
 
From:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:01 AM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
>; Marisa Afzali <
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
>
Cc:
 Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Good day Tahitia and Marisa - 
In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
  
I believe removing the voice over from all is the best way to go.
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.  
That could work, or here’s what we’ve used elsewhere: “My team members’ cultural backgrounds don’t make any difference to me. We’re part of the same team working toward the same business goals, and that’s all we need to work well together”  
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees
 People 
may analyze issues 
differently
 and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)  
I would just use “people” vs “employees”.  We can also remove the extra “differently”
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise.   
Yes, I agree.
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:06 AM
To:
 
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>; Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Post conversation follow-up
 
Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
See above suggestion
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
  
See above suggestion
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
  
Good catch, yes, probably so.  If you can look at alternatives, that would be great
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons
(she/her/hers)
Senior Consultant
LCW

Lake Forest, IL 60045

subject: RE: Post conversation follow-up
body:
Hi Tahitia and Kelly,
 
My apologies for the delay.  This has been a heavy travel and offsite meeting week.  Tahitia – it was terrific to meet you as well. I’m excited to work with you and Kelly – it was wonderful to reconnect!  My thoughts are below
 
From:
 Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:01 AM
To:
 Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com>; Marisa Afzali <Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com>
Cc:
 Monica Marcel <m.marcel@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 [EXTERNAL] RE: Post conversation follow-up
 
Good day Tahitia and Marisa - 
In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
  
I believe removing the voice over from all is the best way to go.
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.  
That could work, or here’s what we’ve used elsewhere: “My team members’ cultural backgrounds don’t make any difference to me. We’re part of the same team working toward the same business goals, and that’s all we need to work well together”  
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees
 People 
may analyze issues 
differently
 and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)  
I would just use “people” vs “employees”.  We can also remove the extra “differently”
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise.   
Yes, I agree.
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <
t.timmons@lcwmail.com
> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:06 AM
To:
 
Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <
k.salek@lcwmail.com
>; Monica Marcel <
m.marcel@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Post conversation follow-up
 
Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
See above suggestion
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
  
See above suggestion
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
  
Good catch, yes, probably so.  If you can look at alternatives, that would be great
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons

Lake Forest, IL 60045

I really do enjoy working with LCW and have learned so much. However,  I do know that I will always wonder and feel regret if I do not devote most of my energy to exploring if I could grow my own work in the health equity space. Knowing we do not have any P/T positions/work, I plan on submitting my formal resignation letter to Dan, Chuck, and yourself tomorrow. I would love to still work with LCW in some capacity however I am not sure if that would be possible and would like us to still meet and chat if you are open to it . 
I wanted to give you a first head up – I won’t even say how emotional this was because of how much I feel connected to your vision around LCW. 
Tahitia

Hi Anne, 
I hope you are well and had a lovely holiday. 
I wanted to connect you with 
Alisa Kolodizner
 who is one of the co-CEOs here at LCW. LCW is looking at expanding their e-learnings and currently investigating different models regarding pricing and best practices. I know that the nursing group has been a leader in e-content for a while and that you have been the big driver for that success. I was hopeful maybe we could pick your brain if you had time over the next couple of weeks. 
LCW also has some great e-content that with some tweaks could meet some of the Nursing groups DEI & Health Equity work, which could also be a future opportunity. 
Thank you, hopefully this will be a fruitful intro for everyone. 
Tahitia

I would love to still work with LCW in some capacity however I am not sure if that would be possible and would like us to still meet and chat if you are open to it . 
I wanted to give you a first head up – I won’t even say how emotional this was because of how much I feel connected to your vision around LCW. 
Tahitia

subject: RE: [Test] You're invited! Prepare for Hispanic Heritage Month with LCW
body:
Hi Tahitia,
 
Thanks for this – I appreciate the flag and want to make sure this doesn’t feel misleading. I do still think the goal is for this to have a “special” or exclusive feel to it and while the conversation is grounded in LCW trainings, we hope participants will see it as a constructive space for their own learning/discussion. I’m wondering if you think it would be helpful to name the specific trainings the activities come from – we do say “this unique event allows participants to experience LCW training activities and come together for meaningful discussion,” so I do think we are disclosing that this is based in our trainings, but am wondering what would address this concern for you.
 
I see that you’re out of the office until Thursday… sorry for the late reply, I was out of office on Monday. I will plan on sending this out Thursday when you are back.
 
Thanks,
 
Jake
 
Jake Pieczynski

j.pieczynski@lcwmail.com

Subject:
 [Test] You're invited! Prepare for Hispanic Heritage Month with LCW
 
 
Join us for an LCW client event: 
Preparing for Hispanic Heritage Month
 
Reserve your seat for this session now!
 
 
You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to this LCW client event!
 
Throughout this one-hour event, we'll explore key experiences that tend to impact your Latinx colleagues, and share proven strategies for building cultural competence for stronger connections with the Latinx community... not only in time for Hispanic Heritage Month, but all-year-long. 
This unique event allows participants to experience LCW training activities and come together for meaningful discussion. Together we will: 
Gain insight into the depth and rich history of the Latinx community
Examine some experiences that tend to shape the identity of many who identify as members of this culture
Discuss strategies for making the Latinx community feel seen, valued, and respected all-year-long
This session is only available by invite! Use the registration link provided in this email and 
reserve up to 3 seats
 for your organization.
Make sure to reserve your seat now; seats for this session are available on a first-come basis!

100 S Saunders Rd, Suite 150
Lake Forest, IL 60045

You can

 or 
unsubscribe from this list

subject: RE: Post conversation follow-up
body:
Good day Tahitia and Marisa - 
In addition to the information below, there are a few things that needs attention: 
 
Module 2: Managing w/Intercultural Competence
Slide 5
…Being that the suggested text not only appears onscreen, but every example (words in the quotes) does have the audio narrated. If we change this one, we will either need to have the voiceover talent rerecord (need to find out availability and cost) or we can remove all the audio pieces from the IDI interaction slides? 
Thoughts?
 
Slide 5: Was this the suggested text we talked about:
It makes no difference to me if my 
teammates 
have cultural differences 
she is from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, thin or fat, black or white, or what religion she belongs to. She’s one of us, and
 
as long as we 
let her know that, we 
can all work together.
 
 
On 
slide 6
, here is what I have written down…
Men and women often
 
Employees 
may analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use.
 (intercultural)
 
Module 5: Evaluating Talent
For the slide that references Kochman’s work is the one shown below. If we change out the references, I do believe that we will also need to exclude or cut the red-marked audio as well. Please advise. 
 
 
From:
 Tahitia Timmons <t.timmons@lcwmail.com> 
Sent:
 Monday, July 11, 2022 11:06 AM
To:
 Marisa_Afzali@Progressive.com
Cc:
 Kelly Salek <k.salek@lcwmail.com>; Monica Marcel <m.marcel@lcwmail.com>
Subject:
 Post conversation follow-up
 
Hello Marisa, 
Thank you for meeting with the team last week. As a newer consultant here at LCW I really appreciated learning about the relationship Progressive and LCW built along with your successes.  Kudos on being named #1 on Forbes list of America’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022! Interesting fact, LCW has worked with 2 of the 5 top companies on the list.
Would you be able to reply to the areas highlighted in the table? Our goal is to have this done quickly, we are tentatively hoping by end of next week. 
I am off but will be monitoring emails as I know this is something your group would like to get completed ASAP. I will also be sending over an estimated quote/sow for the work by tomorrow. 
Thank you 
Tahitia
 
Module
Concern
Suggested change/recommendations
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 5 - intercultural development continuum: Minimization example - "It makes no difference to me if she's from the North or the South, single, married or divorced, black or white, or what religion she belongs to" 
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
 
Managing with Intercultural Competence
Slide 6:  "Men and women often analyze issues differently and communicate about them differently.  I think a group can be more creative if these differences are put to good use"
The Progressive Team will share the language that they have used in other areas with the LCW team.
Evaluating Talent
Page 13: Insight highlights Thomas Kochman’s work on “Black and White Styles in Conflict,” – based on his research, Kochman states that “black and white Americans use two different communication styles for establishing the same goal of trust in communication: truth over peace and peace over truth.”  
It is part of the voiceover, and when the insight is clicked this shows
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
*Marisa were there any concerns regarding the second reference which is about gender difference? We can look for a replacement there too if that would be helpful.
Providing Opportunity
Page 11: 
2nd example– “When we hear dissent from someone from a different race, it provokes more thought than when it comes from someone of our race.” - article citation from Scientific American, “How Diversity Made Us Smarter.” Oct. 2014.   
 
4th example: “The groups with racial diversity significantly outperformed the group with no racial diversity. Being with similar people leads us to think we all hold the same information and share the same perspective. This perspective, which stopped the all-white groups from effectively processing the information, is what hinders creativity and innovation. This is a great reminder as we look for ways to promote from within or staff our teams.” –“Surface level diversity and decision-making in groups: when does deep level similarity help?”
LCW checking for replacement references
LCW will update with new text and audio as needed
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
------------------------------------------------------
Tahitia Timmons

That might be high…Let me know what you think about the document I shared with you and the recommended edits…

subject: [For Monday] Weekly Consulting Meeting--Client Check-in
body:
Hello Consulting Team,
 
As part of the new format of weekly meetings, we are creating an open-ended space for all of us to share experiences working with our clients. On Monday, we will do this for the first time. In preparation, we are asking you to think in advance about examples you might share live in the Monday meeting around the following three areas:
 
Wins
A successful client engagement that can be repeated and/or is otherwise applicable to other consultants
Needs
Client need or ask that you would like the group’s support with
Lessons learned
A learning that will benefit all consultants
 
There is no need to respond to this message.
 Instead, we are sharing in advance so that you can think through which experiences and cases are most useful to share. 
 
Please let us know if you have any questions, and see you on Monday!
 
Thanks,
Dan
 
 
Daniel Gough, PhD
(he, him, his)
Principal Consultant
LCW

From:
 Arlene Roane <arlene@redhouse-performance.com> 
Sent:
 Friday, July 1, 2022 12:41 PM
To:
 Wormley, Nicole A <nicole.wormley@danaher.com>; Chuck Adams <c.adams@lcwmail.com>
Cc:
 Roane, Arlene <arlene.roane@danaher.com>
Subject:
 DHR Exec Sponsorship Program & LCW 
 
Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)
Creating spaces where people BELIEVE they are valued and appreciated.
Redhouse Performance Consulting, LLC
www.redhousepc.com
 
Mobile US 1.513.290.6569
 
 
 
 
 
From:
 Arlene Roane 
Sent:
 Monday, June 27, 2022 8:39 AM
To:
 'Chuck Adams' <
c.adams@lcwmail.com
>
Subject:
 Danaher Corp D+I Projects 
 
Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)

Hi Nicole,
 
Per our meeting last Friday, I have moved forward with contacting Charles (Chuck) Adams at LCW, Redhouse's most trusted partner in all things DEI.   I have worked with Chuck and many others at the firm for over 12 years!  Furthermore, several LCW virtual DEI trainings are in Danaher's online library.
 
LCW has agreed to take the lead in the design and execution of session 3 for the Black Asso. Exec Sponsorship Program.   I also requested LCW’s assistance in providing meaningful content and facilitation for session 2 of the Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program (BTW-  It took considerable effort to convince Jason, that LCW is needed to deliver a meaningful and believable Latin X program for the sponsors.)  My email (attached below) also mentions the possibility of providing executive coaching and support.
 
Chuck is included on this email and will reach out to you separately to ensure that his team is aligned with your understanding and expectations.   Given that I/Redhouse will be pausing operations for 6-8 weeks, I recommended that LCW prepare a brief proposal and execute an agreement/statement of work directly with Danaher Corp D+I.   Hoping LCW’s previous extensive work with Corporate D+I will help make the contracting process move quickly.
 
I will leave it to the two of you to correct and realign the understanding as needed.  I know that I’m passing the baton on these projects to a team who will deliver with excellence.  
 
Best regards,
Arlene F. Roane (She/Her)

Subject:

Hello Chuck,
 
Hope your summer is off to a good start. 
 
I’m reaching out to request your assistance and leadership on several initiatives with Danaher Corp D+I.  I am scheduled to have major surgery on July 13
th
 and would be greatly relieved and encouraged if LCW/you were to step in.   I have already received approval from the CDO, Nicole Wormley.  The projects include:
 
Black Associate Executive Sponsorship Program – This program was initiated in 3Q2021.  Redhouse/I designed and led the executive sponsors thru a process that included the IDI/1x1 in-depth briefings and 2 group learning sessions exploring the significant cultural and day-to-day experiences of Blacks in corporate roles.  Developing and anchoring a panel discussion with Danaher Board Member Shane Sanders and a Black Female Executive (TBD).  LCW can take the lead or we could collaborate on recruiting the Black female.  The target delivery is mid/late 3Q.  The program format can be a hybrid live/virtual.  You and at least one panelist is live; the other panelist(s) can have interviews pre-recorded.  The target audience are Danaher’s senior executive leadership team members who are actively sponsoring mid-career Black executives.  
 
Latin X Executive Sponsorship Program – This program is being initiated now and is intended to follow the same trajectory as the Black Exec Sponsorship Prgm (ESP).  The Sr. Dir Corp D+I (a Black male) is responsible needs assistance in finding and delivering content similar to what was presented in the Black ESP.   LCW’s depth and breadth of content and experienced facilitation is sorely needed.  Target delivery is early to mid 3Q
 
Additionally,  Nicole (the CDO) would like to discuss the possibility of having you (or another Black male) provide executive coaching for the Sr. Director Corp D+I.  I can share more about this when we talk.   I will also brief you on other Redhouse projects at Danaher.  While ultimately I anticipate recovering and getting back to full engagement by  early 4Q, I need to prepare for the possibility of a longer recouperation.
 
I am hoping that we can find time to meet this week. I am available any day EXCEPT Wednesday.  I will be infinitely flexible including early mornings and evenings.  
 
Thank you in advance.

Join us for an LCW client event: 
Preparing for Hispanic Heritage Month
 
Reserve your seat for this session now!
 
 
You've been selected by an LCW staff member for an exclusive invite to this LCW client event!
 
Throughout this one-hour event, we'll explore key experiences that tend to impact your Latinx colleagues, and share proven strategies for building cultural competence for stronger connections with the Latinx community... not only in time for Hispanic Heritage Month, but all-year-long. 
This unique event allows participants to experience LCW training activities and come together for meaningful discussion. Together we will: 
Gain insight into the depth and rich history of the Latinx community
Examine some experiences that tend to shape the identity of many who identify as members of this culture
Discuss strategies for making the Latinx community feel seen, valued, and respected all-year-long
This session is only available by invite! Use the registration link provided in this email and

subject: Progressive
body:
Hi Kelly, 
I quickly grabbed the snapshots of the screens in the module and lined them up to Marisa’s request.  I think the one around last three may be harder as I think it is more then just the reference appearing and I am not sure I understand the rationale for flagging two of these and not all of them. 
The first two we asked for wording as they had some existing verbiage they are already using. 
The training isn’t mandatory but part of the leader/manager onboarding 
They were open to a disclaimer however prefer not to do that 
They are looking to revamp and expand the program 2022-2023
 
Kelly: This is an excerpt from a CE disclosure which touched on two items from The FL Woke act 
The facilitators, authors and planners disclose that to their best knowledge the content presented  is balanced, objective and evidence-based 
 
Thank you

Hi team, 
 
Adrianne is in Cannes this week, and I only have a few items on my list, so I was thinking we could share updates via email this week.  
 
LMK if that works for you, or if there was something specific you wanted to discuss today. 
 
In the meantime, below is what I have on my radar. 
Focus Groups
EMEA
: Confirmed and on the calendar for 7/6.
APAC:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator about additional times for July. 
US API:
 Waiting to hear back from the facilitator. At this point Thursday, 7/7: 11am-12pm CT is probably the best option so let me know if I should look at the second/third weeks of July too. 
1:1 Stakeholder Interviews
Scheduling
: LCW working on time blocks. I also have a meeting with Lisa Moehlenkamp tomorrow to give her a heads up that we’re starting to schedule. 
Questions:
 FH/LCW to finalize questions. 
I know your team is working on those based on our conversation last week. 
To Adrianne’s point on the call, we think there are three “themes” to these conversations: Personal commitment, accountability (for themselves and others) and I also think hearing their perspective on existing barriers or challenges that make it harder for them or their teams to make inclusion a priority, such as business demands from the firm. 
Also, if there are any other themes that have emerged from the focus groups that we want to ask about, such as the point that Dan brought up about utilization, that is great too. 
I also gave this some thought so sharing some ideas below. 
What personal goals/commitments have you made as it relates to DE&I? Can you share an example of actions that have supported those commitments?
As a leader, how are you holding yourself accountable? How do you hold other leaders and managers on your team accountable?
Where does DE&I fit in with your other business priorities?
Would love thoughts on this one. I think it’s easy to say that DE&I is a priority but actually practicing that is more difficult. I think our focus on utilization is a great example. So I want to ask a question that digs into what DE&I being a priority looks like 
in action
 for these leaders beyond just  “voicing support.” 
From the GM deck: Which processes or policies limit or enhance a culture of inclusion and sense of belonging at FleishmanHillard? What is working or not working?
DE&I Certification Exploratory Conversation: Confirmed for 6/30
 
LMK if there is anything I missed. 
 
Thanks!
Rachel 
 
Rachel Coleman (She/Her)
